channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: ‘Balik-Probinsya’ long-term plan to decongest Metro Manila
item.description: Sen. Bong Go’s “Balik Probinsya” proposal that he wants to see implemented after the COVID-19 crisis is meant as a long-term program requiring careful planning and full commitment of support from concerned government agencies and the private sector.

item.title: Groups should be LGU-certified before conducting relief work
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Volunteer organizations must now secure certification from local government units before they can conduct relief operations in areas under enhanced community quarantine.

item.title: Facebook expands video chat feature
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Social media company Facebook is directly taking on videoconference applications such as Zoom with an expanded video chat feature that allows unlimited video calls with up to 50 people.

item.title: Senate to draft rules on teleconference sessions
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Despite the extension of the lockdown or enhanced community quarantine until May 15, the Senate will resume session on May 4 to discuss amending rules to allow lawmakers to conduct teleconference-type sessions to abide with the social distancing policy of the government amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Cloudy skies for Metro Manila, rest of Philippines
item.author: Rhodina Villanueva
item.description: The northeasterly surface windflow is affecting extreme Northern Luzon while the easterlies are affecting the eastern section of the country, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration said yesterday.

item.title: Fuel prices to go down this week
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Local oil companies are expected to further reduce pump prices after US crude prices plunged further and started trading in the negative territory last week.

item.title: ‘Philippines to bounce back better than neighbors’
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The Philippine economy is in a better position to survive the impact of the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis than its neighbors in Southeast Asia, an economist-lawmaker said yesterday.

item.title: Philippines-China music video on COVID draws flak online
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: A music video that aims to highlight the supposed good relations between the Philippines and China, especially in responding to the coronavirus disease pandemic, has drawn widespread negative responses from Filipino social media users.

item.title: PNP plans strategy for GCQ checkpoints
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Philippine National Police has formed an internal group to plan police operations in the implementation of the general community quarantine by the end of the month in moderate risk areas for the coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: China shares COVID-19 lessons with Philippines
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: As the Philippines starts to shift to a new normal by relaxing its quarantine protocols, Chinese Ambassador Huang Xilian shared some lessons learned from Wuhan, Hubei province, the epicenter of the coronavirus disease 2019 in China.
